user_query: the friendly customs of other countries and and starting to dive into that whole thing of being a fish out of water and not understanding the way that people interact in other countries he puts his hand on Josh's leg and he freaks the fuck out it's like a homophobic reaction and the guy scurries off and later on they have a nice little conversation at this bar where he saves him from these murderous kids and it builds up an interesting scenario to where when it's revealed that he's the one who's going to take Josh's life it's a bit of a sick little twist there and fun fact that role was originally going to go to Rutger Hauer I don't know if he was actually uh in the casting process or that's just who Eli Roth had his eye on but they decided to go against an American actor and find somebody that was pretty prevalent in Czech Republic to kind of give a little bit more that authenticity and he does a great job though I do have a burning curiosity of what Rutger Hauer could have done with that role cuz that seems like a perfect role for that guy and I'll always wonder if that might not have been the better version and finally you got to give credit to the gore this is a movie that's trying to shock you with its extremism and how gory and how depraved and how far they go with the torture stuff and the fact that they keep it pretty much completely practical I don't believe there's any CGI in this it really does help with that authenticity it helps make every single injury that you
